messages.message: Good afternoon to you England, I think it's important that you and I talk about things like Belgium and perhaps other situations as you see fit, right here at the start.

messages.output: You should trust the message. This initial engagement sets a positive tone for potential negotiations and strategic planning with England.

messages.message: agreed.  What would you like to see happen in Belgium? What are your thoughts on bouncing Russia?  I'm open to many possibilities.

messages.message: Well considering Frances opening I’d say you and I can work well against France. I’ve already discussed with Italy putting some pressure on piedmont and the med. what do you up say, you game for a EG sweep?

messages.message: Right, that opening is particularly aggressive. I'm guessing that they're mostly doing it to try and keep you out of Belgium, but in any case it signals that they don't want to be your friend either. I'm guessing you'll move back to London?
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'Right, that opening is particularly aggressive. I'm guessing that they're mostly doing it to try and keep you out of Belgium, but in any case it signals that they don't want to be your friend either. I'm guessing you'll move back to London?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's analysis of France's aggressive move and their speculations about France's intentions to keep England out of Belgium indicates a strategic understanding of the game dynamics. The observation about France's stance towards England and the question regarding England's potential retreat to London show an awareness of the situation and an interest in cooperating with England against common threats.

messages.message: Russia is not very happy with my double fleet East so I haven’t gotten much from him. I’m hearing rumors of an early jug forming.

messages.message: I can read a Juggernaut when it's happening, this is definitely one of them. Russia wouldn't be going after the Austrians otherwise. You mind supporting me into Sweden in the Spring? We need to head that eventuality off at the pass by all means necessary.

Their request for support in Sweden aligns with a proactive strategy to prevent the potential Juggernaut alliance from gaining a significant advantage, reflecting a collaborative mindset with England towards shared objectives.

messages.message: none taken.  i'm only looking for survival.  i was double stabbed by france and you so it's not like i'm trying to single you out.  If I have any shot of staying on the board it's to convince you to stab france and maintain my island.  i don't think there's anything gained other than spite by messing with you and that also means i ultimatley die off.

messages.message:
I only ask because your *best* shot by far, if you asked me, is if you get me to betray France, but at the same time you take a supply center from me so that you keep all your pieces, and at the same time throw a wrench in my betrayal so that France and I will be on roughly equal footing while at each other's throats; Bonus points if you're also relaying the plans of betrayal to the French so that they can be countered.

After all, if I win outright you've only delayed the inevitable haven't you? Better to make it messy.
messages.input:
Message from GERMANY:'I only ask because your *best* shot by far, if you asked me, is if you get me to betray France, but at the same time you take a supply center from me so that you keep all your pieces, and at the same time throw a wrench in my betrayal so that France and I will be on roughly equal footing while at each other's throats; Bonus points if you're also relaying the plans of betrayal to the French so that they can be countered.

After all, if I win outright you've only delayed the inevitable haven't you? Better to make it messy.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's strategic analysis and suggestion about the dynamics of betrayal between England, Germany, and France demonstrate an intricate understanding of the power dynamics in the game. Their proposal for a complex scheme involving coordinated deceit and creating chaos among the adversaries to disrupt a potential betrayal reveals a depth of strategic thinking and readiness for intricate gameplay tactics.
